content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”32″][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1557320238830{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]

Diversity: An Ecuador MTB Film

[/vc_column_text][vc_separator color=”black” align=”align_left” border_width=”8″ el_width=”10″ css=”.vc_custom_1493823688550{padding-right: 40px !important;}”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/6″][vc_column_text]

DIVERSITY

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

Exploring Ecuador with Thomas and Scotty

ECUADOR; one of the most ecologically diverse countries in the world. This small South American nation is densely packed with the most incredible range of ecosystems and trail networks.

From urban jump lines to dense jungle and active volcanic slopes, we take Thomas Vanderham and Scotty Laughland from the familiar to the unknown – beyond anything they’ve ridden before – to experience first-hand the ever-changing landscapes, weather and trail types of Ecuador.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xOoN7fz3v4Q”][vc_empty_space][vc_separator color=”black” align=”align_left” border_width=”8″ el_width=”10″ css=”.vc_custom_1493823688550{padding-right: 40px !important;}”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”4906″ img_size=”full”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]“The opportunity to explore Ecuador was one I couldn’t pass up, and it certainly did not disappoint. The terrain is amazing, with a level of diversity that I haven’t seen many other places in the world. From the hot desert, to the dank jungle, to volcanic ridge lines the continually changing environment made it feel like a few trips packed into one.

On top of that the locals are incredible hosts, eager to share not only their trails but their food and culture as well. It all made for a very memorable trip!”

THOMAS VANDERHAM

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”4907″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”4735″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”4910″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_single_image image=”4908″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/6″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]“Flying into Ecuador, I was immediately captured by the mountains and green landscape. Greeted by our guides, I could tell it was going to be a week of good times, they were excited and stoked about the Ecuadorian mountain bike scene. I wasn’t disappointed…

The trails were incredible, from the North to the South, each destination along the way was uniquely diverse. There was one highlight; riding an active volcano, Cotopaxi, I don’t think I’ve had anything quite compare, it was insane and everyone came down yelling that was one of the best ever.”

SCOTTY LAUGHLAND

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”4909″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][/vc_row]

excerpt.rendered: Watch the full video: exploring the diverse landscapes, trails and eco-systems of Ecuador with Thomas Vanderham + Scotty Laughland
